refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: SUMO performs a road traffic simulation. As input data, a network as generated by (SUMO-)NETCONVERT or (SUMO-)NETGEN and a set of vehicle routes as generated by (SUMO-)DUAROUTER or (SUMO-)JTRROUTER is required. Furthermore, one has to supply the begin and end time step of the simulation (in seconds).
There are several output files that may be generated through command line options. Further output may be generated using simulated detectors.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS
refsect1.para: In the following, all possible options are presented.

Please remark, that the configuration-option may be used to supply a file that contains all other parameter's definition. Please take a look into the SUMO user documentation for further information about the usage of configuration files.

The SUMO-network file to use. Mandatory, type:filename, default: none
The file with routes that shall be used. Optional, type:filename, default: none

Forces SUMO to generate <EMISSIONS_FILE> which contains for each timestep the number of loaded, emitted, running, waiting and ended vehicles together with the mean waiting time of vehicles and the mean travel time. Optional, type:filename, default: none

Forces SUMO to generate <TRIPINFO_FILE> which contains for each vehicle the wished departure time (as given within the route file), the real departure time and the time the vehicle has left the simulation. Optional, type:filename, default: none

Forces SUMO to generate <VEHICLE_ROUTES_FILE> which contains for each vehicle the list of used that were valid together with their replacement times and positions and the vehicles departure and ending time. Optional, type:filename, default: none

A list of time intervals for which edge-based network state information shall be generated. This parameter has to be used in conjunction with "--dump-basename" (see there) Optional, type:(list of) unsigned integers, default: none

The basename for edge-based network state information. The name each of the intervals will be saved under is "<DUMPNAME_PREFIX>_<INTERVAL_LENGTH>.xml". The information contains several values for each edge within the network. This parameter has to be used in conjunction with "--lanedump-intervals". Optional, type:(begin of) a filename, default: none

A list of time intervals for which lane-based network state information shall be generated. This parameter has to be used in conjunction with "--dump-basename" (see there) Optional, type:(list of) unsigned integers, default: none

The basename for lane-based network state information. The name each of the intervals will be saved under is "<DUMPNAME_PREFIX>_<INTERVAL_LENGTH>.xml". The information contains several values for each lane within the network. This parameter has to be used in conjunction with "--lanedump-intervals". Optional, type:(begin of) a filename, default: none
A list of time steps the output shall be started at. If not given, the output will be generated for all time steps. Optional, type:list of ints, default: none
A list f time steps the output shall end at. Optional, type:list of ints, default: none

Forces SUMO to generate <NETSTATE_FILE> which contains all edges and lanes and all vehicles' positions and speeds for each timestep. ATTENTION: The output is getting very big in a short time. It is more wise to generate needed values only. Optional, type:filename, default: none

If set to true, <NETSTATE_FILE> will contain also the information about empty lanes, otherwise only information for lanes that contain vehicles will be generated. This parameter is used in conjunction with "--netstate-dump". Optional, type:bool, default: false
A virtual time to specify the begin of the simulation. Previous routes are skipped. Optional (pregiven), type:int, default: 0
A virtual time to specify the end of the simulation. Later routes are skipped. Optional (pregiven), type:int, default: 86400

When set to a positive, nonzero value, this value describes in what intervals routes shall be reloaded. For large simulations, it is quite wise to reload routes stepwise. Optional (pregiven), type:int, default: 0

Normally, when an accident occurs, the simulation should continue and manage it. Still, as the vehicle model is normally collision-free, accidents should be caught. If set to true, this parameter forces the simulation to quit with an error. Optional (pregiven), type:bool, default: false
